segment.source: How to resume an app (DirectX and C++)
segment.target: How to resume an app (DirectX and C++)

segment.source: This topic shows how to restore important application data when the system resumes your Universal Windows Platform (UWP) DirectX app.
segment.target: This topic shows how to restore important application data when the system resumes your Universal Windows Platform (UWP) DirectX app.

segment.source: How to resume an app (DirectX and C++)
segment.target: How to resume an app (DirectX and C++)

segment.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]

segment.source: This topic shows how to restore important application data when the system resumes your Universal Windows Platform (UWP) DirectX app.
segment.target: This topic shows how to restore important application data when the system resumes your Universal Windows Platform (UWP) DirectX app.

segment.source: Register the resuming event handler
segment.target: Register the resuming event handler

segment.source: Register to handle the CoreApplication::Resuming event, which indicates that the user switched away from your app and then back to it.
segment.target: Register to handle the CoreApplication::Resuming event, which indicates that the user switched away from your app and then back to it.

segment.source: Add this code to your implementation of the IFrameworkView::Initialize method of your view provider:
segment.target: Add this code to your implementation of the IFrameworkView::Initialize method of your view provider:

segment.source: Refresh displayed content after suspension
segment.target: Refresh displayed content after suspension

segment.source: When your app handles the Resuming event, it has the opportunity to refresh its displayed content.
segment.target: When your app handles the Resuming event, it has the opportunity to refresh its displayed content.

segment.source: Restore any app you have saved with your handler for CoreApplication::Suspending, and restart processing.
segment.target: Restore any app you have saved with your handler for CoreApplication::Suspending, and restart processing.

segment.source: Game devs: if you've suspended your audio engine, now's the time to restart it.
segment.target: Game devs: if you've suspended your audio engine, now's the time to restart it.

segment.source: This callback occurs as an event message processed by the CoreDispatcher for the app's CoreWindow.
segment.target: This callback occurs as an event message processed by the CoreDispatcher for the app's CoreWindow.

segment.source: This callback will not be invoked if you do not call CoreDispatcher::ProcessEvents from your app's main loop (implemented in the IFrameworkView::Run method of your view provider).
segment.target: This callback will not be invoked if you do not call CoreDispatcher::ProcessEvents from your app's main loop (implemented in the IFrameworkView::Run method of your view provider).

segment.source: Remarks
segment.target: Remarks

segment.source: The system suspends your app whenever the user switches to another app or to the desktop.
segment.target: The system suspends your app whenever the user switches to another app or to the desktop.

segment.source: The system resumes your app whenever the user switches back to it.
segment.target: The system resumes your app whenever the user switches back to it.

segment.source: When the system resumes your app, the content of your variables and data structures is the same as it was before the system suspended the app.
segment.target: When the system resumes your app, the content of your variables and data structures is the same as it was before the system suspended the app.

segment.source: The system restores the app exactly where it left off, so that it appears to the user as if it's been running in the background.
segment.target: The system restores the app exactly where it left off, so that it appears to the user as if it's been running in the background.

segment.source: However, the app may have been suspended for a significant amount of time, so it should refresh any displayed content that might have changed while the app was suspended, and restart any rendering or audio processing threads.
segment.target: However, the app may have been suspended for a significant amount of time, so it should refresh any displayed content that might have changed while the app was suspended, and restart any rendering or audio processing threads.

segment.source: If you've saved any game state data during a previous suspend event, restore it now.
segment.target: If you've saved any game state data during a previous suspend event, restore it now.
